ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned R programming and further developing my statistic knowledge. I find out how effective it is to use R Studio to run a big table with many observations and variables and using codes to find out the mean, variance, standard deviation and etc. I discovered the beauty of statistic and programming and developed my problem-solving skills, perseverance and knowledge.
Methods of data analysis for topics in economics both theoretically and computationally.
I developed data analysis skills to perform tasks that cannot be delegated to computers.

Throughout the course, I learned a lot about RStudio and R language, and I learned a lot about the basic of econometrics and the evaluation standards. Also I learned about statistic knowledge where I could use in the future.
Coding, Learning by myself.
I learned a lot about data analysis and I mastered data analysis using R.
This is a basic statistics course with some applications in economics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strength of the course is that it will provide with both pre-recorded lectures and interactive lectures, which is an very effective way of learning, and the professor teaches clearly.
There is no weakness except the schedule is a bit tight.

Strengths: Syllabus is very organized and the course timeline is extremely clear. Professor Pushkarskaya is very transparent about the difficulty of the course and its fast-paced nature, and she is more than willing to provide academic support. No surprises during the semester. The TA Christian provided very clear feedback on homework and exam performance.
Weaknesses: Could have more guidance related to practice application problems.
A strength is examples were used that are happening in real life right now. More complicated material could be explained more simply.
I am weak in coding because it is the first time that I have learned in coding. I am good at calculating and doing exercises.

The strength is that this course is very knowledge-intensive. The weakness is that the interaction between the teacher and students is not enough, maybe this is because it is an online course. I think in the future more interaction should be involved during class.

The strengths are that you learn what you need to in 5 weeks, it is paced well if you are willing to put in the work. the weaknesses are that you learn what you need to in 5 weeks, it is very quickly paced so it is best to reach out to your peers to form a study group from the beginning and crack challenges that you have right away. Some of the way things are taught is not very intuitive, so it may help to look up some YouTube videos or something to break things down into simplier terms, or get a sense for how to do practice problems.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I will recommend this course to other students who want to major in statistics and data science because the knowledge we learnt in the courses is very useful and essential.
Yes. This is a great for learning R and how we can apply statistical methods to economics.
Yes. You are not taught to do tasks a computer could do. You are taught to complete tasks only humans can do.
Yes, it is relative to the real paper. Although it is difficult, but it is good for you.
Yes. This course is very knowledge-intensive and we can master data analysis after taking this course.

I would recommend this course if you are willing to really study for exams and put in a few hours to do the psets. For a 5 week course, it is facilitated pretty well. If you has previously used R, then that part of the course shouldn't be too challenging, if not then you should be willing to commit to learning some R the first couple weeks.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will use the knowledge and skills I learnt in A-level Statistic 2 and 3. Also, using them for my future university courses. I will use R and statistic knowledge to do more analysis and researches.
I will use my knowledge and skills in the banking world.

The R codes I learned in the course could let me use to evaluate my future data, and the statistical and econometric knowledge I learned could be applied to my future study in economic. Linear regressions I learned here could be applied in my AP courses, which is very helpful.
Make diagrams in the internship and build quantitative models based on the course
I will use the skills I've learned in this course extensively. I will try to use R to conduct data analysis and improve my skills of using R.
